decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo using powerful mana acceleration cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, along with control elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. Once Doomsday is cast, the player can stack their deck with the cards they need to win, usually involving Thassa's Oracle and Personal Tutor to draw and play the necessary cards. The goal is to set up a winning board state as quickly and efficiently as possible to outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Cloudposts and Glimmerposts in order to cast big spells such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will for disruption and protection. The inclusion of Stock Up and Thundertrap Trainer helps to draw cards and filter through the deck efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats and control the game until victory is achieved.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board through disruption and efficient removal spells while also tempo-ing out opponents by applying pressure with early threats like Delver of Secrets and Netheroyf. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also utilizing cheap countermagic like Daze to protect its threats. The deck also aims to use its mana efficiently with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right pieces at the right time.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive plays and efficient card advantage. Utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Murktide Regent, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the game early on while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The combination of aggressive creatures, powerful spells, and disruptive elements allows the deck to maintain a proactive stance in the match, constantly keeping the opponent on their toes and dictating the flow of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan through land destruction, discard spells, and removal. It utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Life from the Loam and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck also strategically uses Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts and generate value. By maintaining control of the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to grind out victories and outlast the opponent in longer games.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Smallpox, while also utilizing Life from the Loam to fuel graveyard synergies and recurring lands. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter allows for land destruction, while Urza's Saga provides additional value and threats. Malevolent Rumble and Grist, the Hunger Tide offer creature removal options, with additional threats like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck aims to control the game through resource denial and grind out advantages over time.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own combo pieces. With the help of cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual, the deck aims to assemble its combo as fast as possible to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck aims to use Stock Up as a way to dig for combo pieces and control the opponent's board. With the help of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Omniscience, the deck can overwhelm opponents with giant threats while protecting itself with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also includes various lands to ensure mana consistency and access to different colors for its spells.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing artifacts to control the board and disrupt opponents, while also maintaining card advantage through recursion and card draw effects. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggro pressure and disruptive plays, utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to generate advantage and close out games quickly. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to transition from aggressive starts to more controlling strategies, adapting to different matchups and game states effectively.

The deck focuses on cheating out big creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn through cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also includes ways to protect the combo with Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats, utilizing cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Omniscience to generate additional value. The inclusion of cards like Stock Up and Brainstorm allow for card selection and manipulation to further enhance the deck's consistency and efficiency.

The main concept of this Legacy combo deck is to manipulate the top of the deck to set up powerful card draws and cheat out huge creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. The deck uses cards like Lim-DÃ»l's Vault, Brainstorm, and Parker Luck to control what is drawn, while also running protection in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, utilizing powerful creatures to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt opponents' strategies while also applying pressure on the board. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thoughtseize disrupt opponents' plans. The deck also aims to control the game with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland, while using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' plans while clocking in with aggressive threats.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting their strategy with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also aims to control the battlefield with cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt while maintaining card advantage with card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Murktide Regent adds additional flexibility and power to the deck, allowing for various strategies to be implemented depending on the matchup.

This deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategy by playing aggressively and controlling the tempo of the game using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also utilizes countermagic like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and interact with the opponent's spells. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistent draws. The mana base is optimized for casting its spells on curve and includes powerful lands like Wasteland for additional disruption.

The main concept of this Legacy Control - Loam deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources with cards like Thoughtseize, Smallpox, Malevolent Rumble, and Witherbloom Command. It aims to control the game by utilizing graveyard recursion with Life from the Loam and Grist, the Hunger Tide, while also generating value with Urza's Saga and Eumidian Hatchery. The deck has a land destruction theme with Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, and includes a mix of creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Barrowgoyf to apply pressure on the opponent. The sideboard and main deck have various ways to combat different strategies, making it versatile in the current Legacy metagame.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters, supported by powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to pump up its creatures and push through for lethal damage. The mana base is built for consistency and includes powerful lands like Wasteland and Karakas to control the battlefield. Overall, this deck aims to win the game through fast, efficient aggression and disruption.
